meanings.sent1: The rubber ball was bouncier than the clay one.
meanings.sent2: The trampoline felt bouncier after it was inflated.
meanings.sent3: The mattress became even bouncier after the cat decided to take a nap on it.
meanings.sent4: Her curls were so bouncier, they seemed to dance in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The new basketball shoes made his steps feel lighter and bouncier.

meanings.definition: Moving in a lively and energetic way.
meanings.sent1: The puppy was bouncier than ever, chasing its tail around the yard.
meanings.sent2: The children were bouncier after having a good night's sleep.
meanings.sent3: The music at the party made everyone feel bouncier on the dance floor.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was bouncier than the bubbles in a fizzy drink.
meanings.sent5: The squirrel's movements were quick and bouncier as it leaped from tree to tree.

meanings.definition: Able to rebound or spring back easily.
meanings.sent1: The tennis ball was bouncier than expected, making it hard to catch.
meanings.sent2: The rubber band became bouncier after being stretched a few times.
meanings.sent3: The clown's nose was so bouncier, it kept popping off his face during the performance.
meanings.sent4: His spirit was bouncier than a beach ball, always rising above challenges.
meanings.sent5: The gymnast's routine was flawless, each move bouncier than the last.
